intro: Cistanthe discolor, commonly known as the white-flowered cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cistanthe discolor is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it thrives in full sun.
